intro: Spathicalyx xanthophylla, commonly known as the golden spathicalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
